proper noun.description: An industrial city in western Georgia, on the Chattahoochee River, noted as a textile center; population 186,984 (est. 2008).
An industrial city in south central Indiana; population 40,001 (est. 2008).
A city in eastern Mississippi, on the Tombigbee River; population 23,798 (est. 2008).
A city in eastern Nebraska, southwest of Lincoln, where the Loup and Platte Rivers meet; pop: 21,595 (est. 2008).
The capital of Ohio, in the central part of the state; population 754,885 (est. 2008).
